meanings.sent1: The boss sacked the employee for being late every day.
meanings.sent2: The company sacked many workers due to budget cuts.
meanings.sent3: After being sacked, the employee decided to start his own business.
meanings.sent4: The decision to sack the manager was a tough one for the company.
meanings.sent5: Being sacked without warning was a shock to the employee.

meanings.sent1: The pirates sacked the village and took all the treasure.
meanings.sent2: During the war, soldiers sacked many homes for supplies.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended to sack the toy store during their game.
meanings.sent4: The burglars planned to sack the mansion under the cover of night.
meanings.sent5: The barbarians would sack cities and leave nothing behind.

meanings.definition: Hit or tackle forcefully in football
meanings.sent1: The quarterback was sacked by the opposing team's defense.
meanings.sent2: The defensive line managed to sack the quarterback before he could pass.
meanings.sent3: The football player joked that he would sack his own teammate during practice.
meanings.sent4: The coach praised the player for his ability to sack the opponent effectively.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered as the defensive player made a crucial sack in the game.
